newsitem.title: CHINA: China sees poor cotton, edible oils output.
newsitem.headline: China sees poor cotton, edible oils output.

text.p: China's Premier Li Peng told parliament on Saturday that cotton and oil-bearing crops were the poorer performers in agriculture last year.
In his annual government work report to the National People's Congress, Li said: "Production fell in cotton and oil-bearing crops because of a reduction in crop-growing area."
China's cotton output for last year has been estimated at 4.0 million tonnes, down by 800,000 tonnes from the year before. Acreage is expected to increase slightly in 1997.
China was expected to produce 6.7-6.8 million tonnes of edible oils in 1997. No figure was available for 1996 output, but official reports have said acreage fell slightly.
Li said China's grain output last year reached a record 480 million tonnes, compared with a previous record of 466 million tonnes the year before.
